content.body: working on RS, having a problem
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: working on RS, having a problem

content.body: for array/object patterns, should we check the length/key first, or check them one by one?
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: for array/object patterns, should we check the length/key first, or check them one by one?

content.formatted_body:
match ([ 0, { get a() { } }, 1]) {
    when ([a, b, ""]): void 0
    // 3rd item check failed
    
    when ([, { a }]): void 0
    // will a triggered?
    // There're already 3 items cached for the iterator.
}

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body:
match ([ 0, { get a() { } }, 1]) {
    when ([a, b, ""]): void 0
    // 3rd item check failed
    
    when ([, { a }]): void 0
    // will a triggered?
    // There're already 3 items cached for the iterator.
}

content.formatted_body:
For object patterns, it is currently one-by-one because it is easier to specify

match ({ get a() {} }) {
    when ({ a, b }): void 0
    // getter a _will_ be triggered, even "b" is missing.
    // because I access them by order
}

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body:
For object patterns, it is currently one-by-one because it is easier to specify

match ({ get a() {} }) {
    when ({ a, b }): void 0
    // getter a _will_ be triggered, even "b" is missing.
    // because I access them by order
}

content.body: It’s iterable not Array, so you can’t check the length first

> <@ljharb:matrix.org> It’s iterable not Array, so you can’t check the length first

You can. If the pattern has 4 items in it, you can try to take 4 items from the iterator and one more call to check if it is done.
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @ljharb:matrix.org
It’s iterable not Array, so you can’t check the length first
You can. If the pattern has 4 items in it, you can try to take 4 items from the iterator and one more call to check if it is done.
